docs.title: SIH Globus Toolkit
docs.text:
Welcome

Streamlined tools for Globus CLI administration, with a focus on group management and bulk operations.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The SIH Globus Toolkit provides wrapper scripts and utilities to simplify common Globus administrative tasks, particularly around group management and bulk user operations.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
Bulk OperationsGroup ManagementUser-Friendly Interface
  • Invite multiple users to groups at once
  • Remove users in batch operations
  • Provision identities automatically
  • List and inspect group details
  • Export group data for backups
  • Comprehensive member management
  • Single command-line interface
  • Dry-run mode for testing
  • Detailed logging and error handling

docs.title: Login Process
docs.text: The Globus CLI uses OAuth2 for authentication with your institutional identity provider.

docs.title: Initial Login
docs.text:
globus login

This command will:

  1. Open your browser to the Globus authentication page
  2. Redirect to your institution (University of Sydney)
  3. Authenticate via Okta using your credentials
  4. Grant permissions to the CLI application
  5. Store tokens locally for future use

docs.title: University of Sydney Integration
docs.text:
The authentication flow is specifically configured for:

  • Identity Provider: University of Sydney
  • Authentication Method: Okta SSO
  • Username Format: username@sydney.edu.au

docs.title: Check Current Session
docs.text:
globus session show

Example output: 

Username: gsam0138@sydney.edu.au
Session expires: 2026-01-27 14:30:00 UTC
Scopes: openid profile email urn:globus:auth:scope:transfer.api.globus.org:all

docs.title: Check Identity
docs.text:
globus whoami

Shows your primary identity and any linked accounts.

docs.title: Session Refresh
docs.text:
Sessions automatically refresh when needed, but you can manually refresh:

globus session update

docs.title: Multiple Identities
docs.text: If you have multiple Globus identities (institutional + personal accounts):

docs.title: List All Identities
docs.text: globus get-identities --provision-identity username@domain.com

docs.title: Switch Primary Identity
docs.text: globus session update --identity username@otherdomain.edu

docs.title: Logout from Current Session
docs.text: globus logout

docs.title: Logout from All Sessions
docs.text: globus logout --all

docs.title: Browser Issues
docs.text:
If the browser doesn't open automatically:

  1. Copy the URL from the terminal
  2. Paste into your browser
  3. Complete authentication
  4. Copy the authorization code back to terminal

docs.title: Token Expiration
docs.text:
If you get authentication errors:

# Check session status
globus session show

# Refresh if expired
globus session update

# Or re-login if needed
globus logout
globus login

docs.title: Institution Not Recognized
docs.text:
If University of Sydney authentication fails:

  1. Verify you're using the correct login portal
  2. Check with IT support for Globus access
  3. Ensure your account has necessary permissions

docs.title: Proxy/Firewall Issues
docs.text:
If behind institutional firewall:

  1. Configure proxy settings: 

    export HTTP_PROXY=http://proxy.sydney.edu.au:8080
export HTTPS_PROXY=http://proxy.sydney.edu.au:8080

  2. Contact IT support for firewall exceptions

docs.title: Security Best Practices
docs.text:
Token Security

  • Tokens are stored in ~/.globus/
  • Don't share or copy these files
  • Use globus logout on shared computers
  • Regularly refresh sessions

docs.title: Token Storage Location
docs.text:
Tokens are stored in: 

~/.globus/
├── config.yml
├── tokens.json
└── client-info.json

docs.title: Permissions and Scopes
docs.text:
The CLI requests these scopes: - OpenID: Basic identity information - Profile: Name and email - Transfer API: File transfer operations - Groups API: Group management (if available)

docs.title: Contributing to SIH Globus Toolkit
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to the SIH Globus Toolkit!

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/yourusername/sih-globus.git
cd sih-globus

  2. Set up Python environment: 

    python -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate  # or .venv\Scripts\activate on Windows
pip install -r requirements-docs.txt

  3. Install pre-commit hooks (optional): 

    pip install pre-commit
pre-commit install

docs.title: Local Development Server
docs.text:
mkdocs serve

Navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000 to see live updates as you edit.

docs.title: Adding New Pages
docs.text:
1. Create markdown files in the docs/ directory
  2. Update mkdocs.yml navigation structure
  3. Test locally with mkdocs serve
  4. Build with mkdocs build to check for errors

docs.title: Script Development
docs.text:
• Follow Python best practices
  • Use type hints where appropriate
  • Include docstrings for functions
  • Handle errors gracefully

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
# Lint code
flake8 scripts/
black --check scripts/

# Test syntax
python -c "import py_compile; [py_compile.compile(f, doraise=True) for f in ['scripts/bulk_invite.py', 'scripts/group_admin.py']]"

# Run demo
./scripts/demo.py

docs.title: Commit Conventions
docs.text:
Use conventional commit prefixes:

  • feat: - New features
  • fix: - Bug fixes
  • docs: - Documentation changes
  • refactor: - Code refactoring
  • test: - Testing updates
  • chore: - Maintenance tasks

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Create a feature branch: git checkout -b feature/your-feature
  3. Make your changes
  4. Test thoroughly
  5. Submit a pull request with clear description

docs.title: Issues and Questions
docs.text:
• Use GitHub Issues for bug reports and feature requests
  • Include relevant error messages and environment details
  • Check existing issues before creating new ones

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.8 or higher
  • pipx (recommended for Globus CLI installation)

docs.title: Install Globus CLI
docs.text: The Globus CLI is the foundation for all administrative tools.

docs.title: Using pipx (Recommended)
docs.text:
# Install pipx if not already available
python3 -m pip install --user pipx
python3 -m pipx ensurepath

# Install Globus CLI
pipx install globus-cli

docs.title: Using pip
docs.text: pip install globus-cli

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
globus version

Expected output: 

Installed version:  3.41.0
Latest version:     3.41.0

You are running the latest version of the Globus CLI

docs.title: Install Administrative Tools
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 

    git clone https://github.com/yourusername/sih-globus.git
cd sih-globus

  2. Make scripts executable: 

    chmod +x scripts/*.py scripts/globus-admin

  3. Install optional dependencies: 

    pip install black flake8  # For development

docs.title: Enable Tab Completion
docs.text:
Add to your shell configuration file (.bashrc, .zshrc, etc.):

eval "$(_GLOBUS_COMPLETE=bash_source globus)"

docs.title: Verify Setup
docs.text:
Run the demo script to verify everything is working:

./scripts/demo.py

Path Setup

If you want to use the tools from anywhere, add the scripts directory to your PATH: 

export PATH="$PATH:/path/to/sih-globus/scripts"

docs.title: Command Not Found
docs.text:
If globus command is not found after installation:

  1. Ensure pipx bin directory is in PATH: 

    pipx ensurepath
source ~/.bashrc  # or ~/.zshrc

  2. Verify installation location: 

    pipx list
which globus

docs.title: Permission Errors
docs.text:
If scripts aren't executable: 

chmod +x scripts/globus-admin scripts/*.py

Next: Quick Start Guide

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get up and running with the Globus administrative tools in minutes.

docs.title: 1. Authentication
docs.text:
First, authenticate with Globus using your institutional credentials:

globus login

This will:

  • Open a browser window
  • Redirect to University of Sydney/Okta login
  • Generate authentication tokens
  • Store credentials locally

docs.title: 2. Verify Login
docs.text:
Check your authentication status:

globus whoami

Expected output: 

gsam0138@sydney.edu.au

docs.title: 3. Explore Your Groups
docs.text:
List all groups you have access to:

./scripts/globus-admin list

Example output: 

Found 3 group(s):
  • University of Sydney (ID: d3f8880c-3693-11f0-9974-0affcae2cfad)
    Role: member
  • USYD RDS Endpoint Activity Monitors (ID: aba55772-a8a2-11f0-831a-0affcae2cfad)
    Role: manager
  • AARNet Subscription Managers (ID: 35c91839-46bc-11f0-b5c4-0e8dfaec7d97)
    Role: admin

docs.title: 4. First Bulk Invitation
docs.text: Let's invite users to a group:

docs.title: Create a Users File
docs.text:
# Create a file with email addresses
cat > my_team.txt << EOF
user1@example.com
user2@university.edu
user3@company.org
EOF

docs.title: Test with Dry Run
docs.text:
./scripts/globus-admin invite YOUR_GROUP_ID \
  --users-file my_team.txt \
  --role member \
  --dry-run \
  --verbose

docs.title: Execute the Invitation
docs.text:
If the dry run looks good:

./scripts/globus-admin invite YOUR_GROUP_ID \
  --users-file my_team.txt \
  --role member

docs.title: Show Group Details
docs.text: ./scripts/globus-admin info YOUR_GROUP_ID

docs.title: List Group Members
docs.text: ./scripts/globus-admin members YOUR_GROUP_ID

docs.title: Export Group Data
docs.text: ./scripts/group_admin.py export YOUR_GROUP_ID --output backup.json

docs.title: Team Onboarding
docs.text:
# 1. Create team file
echo "newuser@company.com" >> new_team.txt

# 2. Test invitation
./scripts/globus-admin invite GROUP_ID --users-file new_team.txt --dry-run

# 3. Execute with identity provisioning
./scripts/globus-admin invite GROUP_ID --users-file new_team.txt --provision

docs.title: Group Audit
docs.text:
# Export current state
./scripts/group_admin.py export GROUP_ID --output audit_$(date +%Y%m%d).json

# Review members
./scripts/globus-admin members GROUP_ID

# Check group settings
./scripts/globus-admin info GROUP_ID

docs.title: Bulk Invite Tool
docs.text: The bulk invite script allows you to invite multiple users to a Globus group in a single operation.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text: ./scripts/bulk_invite.py GROUP_ID [OPTIONS]

docs.title: From File
docs.text:
Create a users file with one email address per line:

# users.txt
user1@example.com
user2@university.edu
user3@company.org

# Comments are ignored
# Empty lines are skipped

Then run: 

./scripts/bulk_invite.py abc123-group-id --users-file users.txt

docs.title: From Command Line
docs.text:
./scripts/bulk_invite.py abc123-group-id \
  --users user1@example.com user2@university.edu user3@company.org

docs.title: Options Reference
docs.text: Option Short Description Default --users-file FILE -f File containing user list None --users USER [USER...] -u Space-separated users None --role ROLE -r Role to assign member --provision -p Provision identities if missing False --dry-run -d Show actions without executing False --verbose -v Detailed output False

docs.title: Role Types
docs.text: Role Permissions Use Case member Basic group access Regular users manager Can manage members Team leads admin Full group control Administrators

docs.title: New Team Onboarding
docs.text:
# Create team file
cat > new_hires_q1.txt << EOF
alice.smith@company.com
bob.jones@company.com
carol.brown@company.com
EOF

# Test first
./scripts/bulk_invite.py team-group-id \
  --users-file new_hires_q1.txt \
  --role member \
  --dry-run \
  --verbose

# Execute if looks good
./scripts/bulk_invite.py team-group-id \
  --users-file new_hires_q1.txt \
  --role member \
  --provision

docs.title: Promote Existing Members
docs.text:
# Promote specific users to managers
./scripts/bulk_invite.py project-group-id \
  --users senior.dev@company.com team.lead@company.com \
  --role manager

docs.title: External Collaborators
docs.text:
# Add external users with identity provisioning
./scripts/bulk_invite.py collaboration-group-id \
  --users external1@partner.org external2@university.edu \
  --role member \
  --provision

docs.title: Common Errors
docs.text:
Identity Not Found 

✗ Failed: user@domain.com - Identity not found
Solution: Use --provision flag or verify email address

Insufficient Permissions 

✗ Failed: HTTP 403 - Insufficient permissions
Solution: Verify you have admin/manager role in the group

Already a Member 

✗ Failed: user@domain.com - Already a member
Solution: Remove from error list or use group management tools

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
Safety First

  • Always use --dry-run before actual execution
  • Start with small batches to test permissions
  • Keep backups of user lists

File Management

  • Use descriptive filenames: spring2026_students.txt
  • Include dates in bulk operations
  • Comment your user files for context

Identity Provisioning

  • Only use --provision when necessary
  • Verify external email addresses
  • Understand your organization's identity policies

docs.title: Administrative Tools Overview
docs.text: The SIH Globus Toolkit provides several wrapper scripts that simplify common group administration tasks.

docs.title: globus-admin - Unified Command Interface
docs.text:
The primary entry point for all administrative operations:

./scripts/globus-admin <command> [options]

Available Commands:

Command Purpose Example list Show all your groups ./scripts/globus-admin list info Display group details ./scripts/globus-admin info GROUP_ID members List group members ./scripts/globus-admin members GROUP_ID invite Bulk invite users ./scripts/globus-admin invite GROUP_ID --users-file users.txt help Show usage information ./scripts/globus-admin help

docs.title: 1. Bulk Invite (bulk_invite.py)
docs.text:
Purpose: Invite multiple users to a Globus group simultaneously.

Key Features: - Read users from file or command line - Support for different roles (member, manager, admin) - Dry-run mode for testing - Identity provisioning - Detailed error reporting

Usage Examples: 

# From file
./scripts/bulk_invite.py GROUP_ID --users-file team.txt --role member

# From command line
./scripts/bulk_invite.py GROUP_ID --users user1@domain.com user2@domain.com --role manager

# With dry run
./scripts/bulk_invite.py GROUP_ID --users-file team.txt --dry-run --verbose

docs.title: 2. Group Administration (group_admin.py)
docs.text:
Purpose: Comprehensive group management operations.

Key Features: - List and inspect groups - Member management - Data export for backups - Bulk removal operations

Usage Examples: 

# List all groups
./scripts/group_admin.py list

# Export group data
./scripts/group_admin.py export GROUP_ID --output backup.json

# Bulk remove users
./scripts/group_admin.py bulk-remove GROUP_ID --users user1 user2

docs.title: 3. Demo & Testing (demo.py)
docs.text:
Purpose: Testing and demonstration of all functionality.

Features: - Login status verification - Usage examples - Quick start guidance - Safe testing without real operations

docs.title: Common Workflows
docs.text: This guide covers typical administrative tasks and how to accomplish them efficiently.

docs.title: Scenario: Adding New Team Members
docs.text:
Goal: Invite multiple new employees to your project group.

Steps:

  1. Prepare user list: 

    cat > new_team_q1_2026.txt << EOF
alice.smith@company.com
bob.jones@company.com
carol.brown@company.com
EOF

  2. Test the invitation: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin invite PROJECT_GROUP_ID \
  --users-file new_team_q1_2026.txt \
  --role member \
  --dry-run \
  --verbose

  3. Execute the invitation: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin invite PROJECT_GROUP_ID \
  --users-file new_team_q1_2026.txt \
  --role member \
  --provision

  4. Verify the results: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin members PROJECT_GROUP_ID

docs.title: Scenario: Regular Group Audit
docs.text:
Goal: Review group membership and export data for compliance.

Steps:

  1. Export current state: 

    DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d)
./scripts/group_admin.py export GROUP_ID --output "audit_${DATE}.json"

  2. Review group information: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin info GROUP_ID
./scripts/globus-admin members GROUP_ID

  3. Generate member list: 

    ./scripts/group_admin.py members GROUP_ID | tee "members_${DATE}.txt"

docs.title: Scenario: Removing Inactive Users
docs.text:
Goal: Clean up group membership by removing users who are no longer active.

Steps:

  1. Identify users to remove (manual process or from HR system): 

    cat > inactive_users.txt << EOF
former.employee@company.com
contractor.finished@external.com
EOF

  2. Remove users: 

    ./scripts/group_admin.py bulk-remove GROUP_ID --users-file inactive_users.txt

  3. Verify removal: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin members GROUP_ID

docs.title: Scenario: Promoting Users
docs.text:
Goal: Promote existing members to managers or admins.

Current State: Users are members Desired State: Users are managers

Steps:

  1. List current members: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin members GROUP_ID > current_members.txt

  2. Identify users to promote: 

    cat > promote_to_manager.txt << EOF
senior.dev@company.com
team.lead@company.com
EOF

  3. Remove them first (Globus requires removal before role change): 

    ./scripts/group_admin.py bulk-remove GROUP_ID --users-file promote_to_manager.txt

  4. Re-add with new role: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin invite GROUP_ID \
  --users-file promote_to_manager.txt \
  --role manager

docs.title: Scenario: Adding External Partners
docs.text:
Goal: Add collaborators from other institutions.

Considerations: - External users may not have existing Globus identities - Need identity provisioning - Different institutional authentication

Steps:

  1. Prepare external user list: 

    cat > external_collaborators.txt << EOF
# University partners
prof.smith@partner-university.edu
researcher.jones@research-institute.org

# Industry partners
contact@partner-company.com
EOF

  2. Invite with identity provisioning: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin invite COLLABORATION_GROUP_ID \
  --users-file external_collaborators.txt \
  --role member \
  --provision \
  --verbose

  3. Follow up on failures (manual verification may be needed):

  4. Check email addresses for typos
  5. Contact users to ensure they complete registration
  6. Verify institutional access policies

docs.title: Scenario: Large User Import
docs.text:
Goal: Import 100+ users efficiently and safely.

Strategy: Break into smaller batches to manage errors.

Steps:

  1. Split large user list: 

    split -l 20 all_users.txt batch_
# Creates: batch_aa, batch_ab, batch_ac, etc.

  2. Process each batch: 

    for batch in batch_*; do
  echo "Processing $batch..."
  ./scripts/globus-admin invite GROUP_ID \
    --users-file "$batch" \
    --role member \
    --provision \
    --verbose
  sleep 2  # Brief pause between batches
done

  3. Collect results: 

    ./scripts/globus-admin members GROUP_ID > final_members.txt
wc -l final_members.txt  # Count total members

docs.title: Scenario: CI/CD Integration
docs.text:
Goal: Automate group management with external systems.

GitHub Actions Example: 

name: Update Group Membership
on:
  push:
    paths: ['team-members.txt']

jobs:
  update-group:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    - name: Install Globus CLI
      run: pipx install globus-cli
    - name: Authenticate
      run: echo "${{ secrets.GLOBUS_TOKEN }}" | globus login --stdin
    - name: Update group
      run: |
        ./scripts/globus-admin invite ${{ secrets.GROUP_ID }} \
          --users-file team-members.txt \
          --role member

docs.title: Scenario: Scheduled Maintenance
docs.text:
Goal: Regular group cleanup via cron job.

Cron Script (/scripts/maintenance.sh): 

#!/bin/bash
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d)
GROUP_ID="your-group-id"

# Export current state
./scripts/group_admin.py export $GROUP_ID --output "backup_${DATE}.json"

# Run any scheduled updates
# (could read from HR system, LDAP, etc.)

# Log results
echo "Maintenance completed: $DATE" >> maintenance.log

Crontab Entry: 

# Run weekly maintenance on Sundays at 2 AM
0 2 * * 0 /path/to/sih-globus/scripts/maintenance.sh

docs.title: Common Issues and Solutions
docs.text:
Authentication Expired:
